questions.question_text: $$\mathrm{A}_{(\mathrm{g})} \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{B}_{(\mathrm{g})}+\frac{\mathrm{C}}{2}(\mathrm{g})$$ The correct relationship between $$\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{P}}, \alpha$$ and equilibrium pressure $$\mathrm{P}$$ is

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Identify major product 'P' formed in the following reaction.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I : Group 13 trivalent halides get easily hydrolyzed by water due to their covalent nature.

Statement II : $$\mathrm{AlCl}_3$$ upon hydrolysis in acidified aqueous solution forms octahedral $$\left[\mathrm{Al}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+}$$ ion.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Statement I is false but statement II is true
option_texts.B: Both statement I and statement II are true
option_texts.C: Both statement I and statement II are false
option_texts.D: Statement I is true but statement II is false

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The azo-dye $$(Y)$$ formed in the following reactions is

Sulphanilic acid $$+\mathrm{NaNO}_2+\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{COOH} \rightarrow \mathrm{X}$$.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I : $$\mathrm{S}_8$$ solid undergoes disproportionation reaction under alkaline conditions to form $$\mathrm{S}^{2-}$$ and $$\mathrm{S}_2 \mathrm{O}_3{ }^{2-}$$.

Statement II : $$\mathrm{ClO}_4^{-}$$ can undergo disproportionation reaction under acidic condition.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect
option_texts.B: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect
option_texts.C: Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are correct

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Identify structure of 2,3-dibromo-1-phenylpentane.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Choose the correct statements from the following

A. All group 16 elements form oxides of general formula $$\mathrm{EO}_2$$ and $$\mathrm{EO}_3$$, where $$\mathrm{E}=\mathrm{S}, \mathrm{Se}, \mathrm{Te}$$ and $$\mathrm{Po}$$. Both the types of oxides are acidic in nature.

B. $$\mathrm{TeO}_2$$ is an oxidising agent while $$\mathrm{SO}_2$$ is reducing in nature.

C. The reducing property decreases from $$\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{~S}$$ to $$\mathrm{H}_2$$ Te down the group.

D. The ozone molecule contains five lone pairs of electrons.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The correct order of reactivity in electrophilic substitution reaction of the following compounds is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Choose the correct statements from the following

A. $$\mathrm{Mn}_2 \mathrm{O}_7$$ is an oil at room temperature

B. $$\mathrm{V}_2 \mathrm{O}_4$$ reacts with acid to give $$\mathrm{VO}_2{ }^{2+}$$

C. $$\mathrm{CrO}$$ is a basic oxide

D. $$\mathrm{V}_2 \mathrm{O}_5$$ does not react with acid

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Consider the following elements.



Which of the following is/are true about $$\mathrm{A}^{\prime}, \mathrm{B}^{\prime}, \mathrm{C}^{\prime}$$ and $$\mathrm{D}^{\prime}$$ ?

A. Order of atomic radii: $$\mathrm{B}^{\prime}<\mathrm{A}^{\prime}<\mathrm{D}^{\prime}<\mathrm{C}^{\prime}$$

B. Order of metallic character: $$\mathrm{B}^{\prime}<\mathrm{A}^{\prime}<\mathrm{D}^{\prime}<\mathrm{C}^{\prime}$$

C. Size of the element: $$\mathrm{D}^{\prime}<\mathrm{C}^{\prime}<\mathrm{B}^{\prime}<\mathrm{A}^{\prime}$$

D. Order of ionic radii: $$\mathrm{B}^{\prime+}<\mathrm{A}^{1^{+}}<\mathrm{D}^{\prime+}<\mathrm{C}^{+}$$

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The fragrance of flowers is due to the presence of some steam volatile organic compounds called essential oils. These are generally insoluble in water at room temperature but are miscible with water vapour in vapour phase. A suitable method for the extraction of these oils from the flowers is -

questions.question_text: Identify A and B in the following reaction sequence.

Match List I with List II

.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-baqh{text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-amwm{font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0lax{text-align:left;vertical-align:top}

(Complex ion)
    
    List - II
(Electronic Configuration)

    $$\mathrm{[Cr(H_2O)_6]^{3+}}$$
    (I)
    $$t_{2 g}{ }^2 e_g^0$$

    $$\left[\mathrm{Fe}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+}$$
    (II)
    $$t_{2 g}{ }^3 e_g{ }^0$$
  
  
    (C)
    $$\left[\mathrm{Ni}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{2+}$$
    (III)
    $$t_{2 g}{ }^3 e_g{ }^2$$
  
  
    (D)
    $$\left[\mathrm{V}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+}$$
    (IV)
    $$t_{2 g}{ }^6 e_g^2$$

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : Aniline reacts with con. $$\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{SO}_4$$, followed by heating at $$453-473 \mathrm{~K}$$ gives $$\mathrm{p}$$-aminobenzene sulphonic acid, which gives blood red colour in the 'Lassaigne's test'.

Statement II : In Friedel - Craft's alkylation and acylation reactions, aniline forms salt with the $$\mathrm{AlCl}_3$$ catalyst. Due to this, nitrogen of aniline aquires a positive charge and acts as deactivating group.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both statement I and statement II are true
option_texts.B: Statement I is true but statement II is false
option_texts.C: Statement I is false but statement II is true
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are false

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A sample of $$\mathrm{CaCO}_3$$ and $$\mathrm{MgCO}_3$$ weighed $$2.21 \mathrm{~g}$$ is ignited to constant weight of $$1.152 \mathrm{~g}$$. The composition of mixture is :

(Given molar mass in $$\mathrm{g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1} \mathrm{CaCO}_3: 100, \mathrm{MgCO}_3: 84$$)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: From the vitamins $$\mathrm{A}, \mathrm{B}_1, \mathrm{~B}_6, \mathrm{~B}_{12}, \mathrm{C}, \mathrm{D}, \mathrm{E}$$ and $$\mathrm{K}$$, the number of vitamins that can be stored in our body is _________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A diatomic molecule has a dipole moment of $$1.2 \mathrm{~D}$$. If the bond distance is $$1 \mathrm{~A}^{\circ}$$, then fractional charge on each atom is _________ $$\times 10^{-1}$$ esu.

(Given $$1 \mathrm{~D}=10^{-18}$$ esucm)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Number of isomeric products formed by monochlorination of 2-methylbutane in presence of sunlight is ________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In the reaction of potassium dichromate, potassium chloride and sulfuric acid (conc.), the oxidation state of the chromium in the product is $$(+)$$ _________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The values of conductivity of some materials at $298.15 \mathrm{~K}^{-1} ~\text{in} ~\mathrm{Sm}^{-1}$ are $2.1 \times 10^3$,

 $1.0 \times 10^{-16}, 1.2 \times 10,3.91,1.5 \times 10^{-2}, 1 \times 10^{-7}, 1.0 \times 10^3$.

 The number of conductors among the materials is _____________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: A compound $$(x)$$ with molar mass $$108 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$ undergoes acetylation to give product with molar mass $$192 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$. The number of amino groups in the compound $$(x)$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Number of moles of $$\mathrm{H}^{+}$$ ions required by $$1 \mathrm{~mole}$$ of  $$\mathrm{MnO}_4^{-}$$ to oxidise oxalate ion to $$\mathrm{CO}_2$$ is _________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
If 5 moles of an ideal gas expands from $$10 \mathrm{~L}$$ to a volume of $$100 \mathrm{~L}$$ at $$300 \mathrm{~K}$$ under isothermal and reversible condition then work, $$\mathrm{w}$$, is $$-x \mathrm{~J}$$. The value of $$x$$ is __________.

(Given R = 8.314 J K$$^{-1}$$ mol$$^{-1}$$)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The molarity of $$1 \mathrm{~L}$$ orthophosphoric acid $$\left(\mathrm{H}_3 \mathrm{PO}_4\right)$$ having $$70 \%$$ purity by weight (specific gravity $$1.54 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~cm}^{-3}$$) is __________ $$\mathrm{M}$$.

(Molar mass of $$\mathrm{H}_3 \mathrm{PO}_4=98 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: $$\mathrm{r}=\mathrm{k}[\mathrm{A}]$$ for a reaction, $$50 \%$$ of $$\mathrm{A}$$ is decomposed in 120 minutes. The time taken for $$90 \%$$ decomposition of $$\mathrm{A}$$ is _________ minutes.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$A$$ be a $$3 \times 3$$ real matrix such that

$$A\left(\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right)=2\left(\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right), A\left(\begin{array}{l}
-1 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right)=4\left(\begin{array}{l}
-1 \\
0 \\
1
\end{array}\right), A\left(\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right)=2\left(\begin{array}{l}
0 \\
1 \\
0
\end{array}\right) \text {. }$$

Then, the system $$(A-3 I)\left(\begin{array}{l}x \\ y \\ z\end{array}\right)=\left(\begin{array}{l}1 \\ 2 \\ 3\end{array}\right)$$ has :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$(\alpha, \beta, \gamma)$$ be the mirror image of the point $$(2,3,5)$$ in the line $$\frac{x-1}{2}=\frac{y-2}{3}=\frac{z-3}{4}$$. Then, $$2 \alpha+3 \beta+4 \gamma$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$a=\sin ^{-1}(\sin (5))$$ and $$b=\cos ^{-1}(\cos (5))$$, then $$a^2+b^2$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$P$$ be a parabola with vertex $$(2,3)$$ and directrix $$2 x+y=6$$. Let an ellipse $$E: \frac{x^2}{a^2}+\frac{y^2}{b^2}=1, a>b$$, of eccentricity $$\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}$$ pass through the focus of the parabola $$P$$. Then, the square of the length of the latus rectum of $$E$$, is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of solutions, of the equation $$e^{\sin x}-2 e^{-\sin x}=2$$, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The shortest distance, between lines $$L_1$$ and $$L_2$$, where $$L_1: \frac{x-1}{2}=\frac{y+1}{-3}=\frac{z+4}{2}$$ and $$L_2$$ is the line, passing through the points $$\mathrm{A}(-4,4,3), \mathrm{B}(-1,6,3)$$ and perpendicular to the line $$\frac{x-3}{-2}=\frac{y}{3}=\frac{z-1}{1}$$, is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area of the region enclosed by the parabolas $$y=4 x-x^2$$ and $$3 y=(x-4)^2$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$f, g:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$$ be two functions defined by $$f(x)=\int\limits_{-x}^x\left(|t|-t^2\right) e^{-t^2} d t$$ and $$g(x)=\int\limits_0^{x^2} t^{1 / 2} e^{-t} d t$$. Then, the value of $$9\left(f\left(\sqrt{\log _e 9}\right)+g\left(\sqrt{\log _e 9}\right)\right)$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$f: \rightarrow \mathbb{R} \rightarrow(0, \infty)$$ be strictly increasing function such that $$\lim _\limits{x \rightarrow \infty} \frac{f(7 x)}{f(x)}=1$$. Then, the value of $$\lim _\limits{x \rightarrow \infty}\left[\frac{f(5 x)}{f(x)}-1\right]$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The temperature $$T(t)$$ of a body at time $$t=0$$ is $$160^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$$ and it decreases continuously as per the differential equation $$\frac{d T}{d t}=-K(T-80)$$, where $$K$$ is a positive constant. If $$T(15)=120^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$$, then $$T(45)$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the function $$f:(-\infty,-1] \rightarrow(a, b]$$ defined by $$f(x)=e^{x^3-3 x+1}$$ is one - one and onto, then the distance of the point $$P(2 b+4, a+2)$$ from the line $$x+e^{-3} y=4$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$2^{\text {nd }}, 8^{\text {th }}$$ and $$44^{\text {th }}$$ terms of a non-constant A. P. be respectively the $$1^{\text {st }}, 2^{\text {nd }}$$ and $$3^{\text {rd }}$$ terms of a G. P. If the first term of the A. P. is 1, then the sum of its first 20 terms is equal to -

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$z_1$$ and $$z_2$$ be two complex numbers such that $$z_1+z_2=5$$ and $$z_1^3+z_2^3=20+15 i$$ Then, $$\left|z_1^4+z_2^4\right|$$ equals -

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Consider the function $$f:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$$ defined by $$f(x)=e^{-\left|\log _e x\right|}$$. If $$m$$ and $$n$$ be respectively the number of points at which $$f$$ is not continuous and $$f$$ is not differentiable, then $$m+n$$ is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let a variable line passing through the centre of the circle $$x^2+y^2-16 x-4 y=0$$, meet the positive co-ordinate axes at the points $$A$$ and $$B$$. Then the minimum value of $$O A+O B$$, where $$O$$ is the origin, is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$A(a, b), B(3,4)$$ and $$C(-6,-8)$$ respectively denote the centroid, circumcentre and orthocentre of a triangle. Then, the distance of the point $$P(2 a+3,7 b+5)$$ from the line $$2 x+3 y-4=0$$ measured parallel to the line $$x-2 y-1=0$$ is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let the mean and the variance of 6 observations $$a, b, 68,44,48,60$$ be $$55$$ and $$194$$, respectively. If $$a>b$$, then $$a+3 b$$ is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$\vec{a}=3 \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}+\hat{k}, \vec{b}=2 \hat{i}-\hat{j}+3 \hat{k}$$ and $$\vec{c}$$ be a vector such that $$(\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times \vec{c}=2(\vec{a} \times \vec{b})+24 \hat{j}-6 \hat{k}$$ and $$(\vec{a}-\vec{b}+\hat{i}) \cdot \vec{c}=-3$$. Then $$|\vec{c}|^2$$ is equal to ________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$y=y(x)$$ be the solution of the differential equation 


$$\sec ^2 x d x+\left(e^{2 y} \tan ^2 x+\tan x\right) d y=0,0< x<\frac{\pi}{2}, y(\pi / 4)=0$$. 


If $$y(\pi / 6)=\alpha$$, then $$e^{8 \alpha}$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: $$\left|\frac{120}{\pi^3} \int_\limits0^\pi \frac{x^2 \sin x \cos x}{\sin ^4 x+\cos ^4 x} d x\right| \text { is equal to }$$ ________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$A(-2,-1), B(1,0), C(\alpha, \beta)$$ and $$D(\gamma, \delta)$$ be the vertices of a parallelogram $$A B C D$$. If the point $$C$$ lies on $$2 x-y=5$$ and the point $$D$$ lies on $$3 x-2 y=6$$, then the value of $$|\alpha+\beta+\gamma+\delta|$$ is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$a, b, c$$ be the lengths of three sides of a triangle satistying the condition $$\left(a^2+b^2\right) x^2-2 b(a+c) x+\left(b^2+c^2\right)=0$$. If the set of all possible values of $$x$$ is the interval $$(\alpha, \beta)$$, then $$12\left(\alpha^2+\beta^2\right)$$ is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$\lim _\limits{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{a x^2 e^x-b \log _e(1+x)+c x e^{-x}}{x^2 \sin x}=1$$, then $$16\left(a^2+b^2+c^2\right)$$ is equal to ________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$A=\{1,2,3, \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots, 100\}$$. Let $$R$$ be a relation on $$\mathrm{A}$$ defined by $$(x, y) \in R$$ if and only if $$2 x=3 y$$. Let $$R_1$$ be a symmetric relation on $$A$$ such that $$R \subset R_1$$ and the number of elements in $$R_1$$ is $$\mathrm{n}$$. Then, the minimum value of $$\mathrm{n}$$ is _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let the coefficient of $$x^r$$ in the expansion of $$(x+3)^{n-1}+(x+3)^{n-2}(x+2)+(x+3)^{n-3}(x+2)^2+\ldots \ldots \ldots .+(x+2)^{n-1}$$ be $$\alpha_r$$. If $$\sum_\limits{r=0}^n \alpha_r=\beta^n-\gamma^n, \beta, \gamma \in \mathbb{N}$$, then the value of $$\beta^2+\gamma^2$$ equals _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A be a $$3 \times 3$$ matrix and $$\operatorname{det}(A)=2$$. If $$n=\operatorname{det}(\underbrace{\operatorname{adj}(\operatorname{adj}(\ldots . .(\operatorname{adj} A))}_{2024-\text { times }}))$$, then the remainder when $$n$$ is divided by 9 is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A line passes through $$A(4,-6,-2)$$ and $$B(16,-2,4)$$. The point $$P(a, b, c)$$, where $$a, b, c$$ are non-negative integers, on the line $$A B$$ lies at a distance of 21 units, from the point $$A$$. The distance between the points $$P(a, b, c)$$ and $$Q(4,-12,3)$$ is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I: Electromagnetic waves carry energy as they travel through space and this energy is equally shared by the electric and magnetic fields.

Statement II: When electromagnetic waves strike a surface, a pressure is exerted on the surface.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

option_texts.A: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
option_texts.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
option_texts.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Consider two physical quantities $$A$$ and $$B$$ related to each other as $$E=\frac{B-x^2}{A t}$$ where $$E, x$$ and $$t$$ have dimensions of energy, length and time respectively. The dimension of $$A B$$ is

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a photoelectric effect experiment a light of frequency 1.5 times the threshold frequency is made to fall on the surface of photosensitive material. Now if the frequency is halved and intensity is doubled, the number of photo electrons emitted will be:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The mass number of nucleus having radius equal to half of the radius of nucleus with mass number 192 is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A uniform magnetic field of $$2 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~T}$$ acts along positive $$Y$$-direction. A rectangular loop of sides $$20 \mathrm{~cm}$$ and $$10 \mathrm{~cm}$$ with current of $$5 \mathrm{~A}$$ is in $$Y-Z$$ plane. The current is in anticlockwise sense with reference to negative $$X$$ axis. Magnitude and direction of the torque is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A block of mass $$5 \mathrm{~kg}$$ is placed on a rough inclined surface as shown in the figure. If $$\overrightarrow{F_1}$$ is the force required to just move the block up the inclined plane and $$\overrightarrow{F_2}$$ is the force required to just prevent the block from sliding down, then the value of $$\left|\overrightarrow{F_1}\right|-\left|\overrightarrow{F_2}\right|$$ is : [Use $$\left.\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2\right]$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If two vectors $$\vec{A}$$ and $$\vec{B}$$ having equal magnitude $$R$$ are inclined at angle $$\theta$$, then

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: By what percentage will the illumination of the lamp decrease if the current drops by 20%?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The speed of sound in oxygen at S.T.P. will be approximately: (given, $$R=8.3 \mathrm{~JK}^{-1}, \gamma=1.4$$)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A light string passing over a smooth light fixed pulley connects two blocks of masses $$m_1$$ and $$m_2$$. If the acceleration of the system is $$g / 8$$, then the ratio of masses is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A gas mixture consists of 8 moles of argon and 6 moles of oxygen at temperature T. Neglecting all vibrational modes, the total internal energy of the system is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A small spherical ball of radius $$r$$, falling through a viscous medium of negligible density has terminal velocity '$$v$$'. Another ball of the same mass but of radius $$2 r$$, falling through the same viscous medium will have terminal velocity:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The measured value of the length of a simple pendulum is $$20 \mathrm{~cm}$$ with $$2 \mathrm{~mm}$$ accuracy. The time for 50 oscillations was measured to be 40 seconds with 1 second resolution. From these measurements, the accuracy in the measurement of acceleration due to gravity is $$\mathrm{N} \%$$. The value of $$\mathrm{N}$$ is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: When unpolarized light is incident at an angle of $$60^{\circ}$$ on a transparent medium from air, the reflected ray is completely polarized. The angle of refraction in the medium is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The resistance per centimeter of a meter bridge wire is $$r$$, with $$X \Omega$$ resistance in left gap. Balancing length from left end is at $$40 \mathrm{~cm}$$ with $$25 \Omega$$ resistance in right gap. Now the wire is replaced by another wire of $$2 r$$ resistance per centimeter. The new balancing length for same settings will be at

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Force between two point charges $$q_1$$ and $$q_2$$ placed in vacuum at '$$r$$' cm apart is $$F$$. Force between them when placed in a medium having dielectric constant $$K=5$$ at '$$r / 5$$' $$\mathrm{cm}$$ apart will be:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body of mass $$2 \mathrm{~kg}$$ begins to move under the action of a time dependent force given by $$\vec{F}=\left(6 t \hat{i}+6 t^2 \hat{j}\right) N$$. The power developed by the force at the time $$t$$ is given by:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An AC voltage $$V=20 \sin 200 \pi t$$ is applied to a series LCR circuit which drives a current $$I=10 \sin \left(200 \pi t+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)$$. The average power dissipated is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The mass of the moon is $$\frac{1}{144}$$ times the mass of a planet and its diameter is $$\frac{1}{16}$$ times the diameter of a planet. If the escape velocity on the planet is $$v$$, the escape velocity on the moon will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The output of the given circuit diagram is -

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two blocks of mass $$2 \mathrm{~kg}$$ and $$4 \mathrm{~kg}$$ are connected by a metal wire going over a smooth pulley as shown in figure. The radius of wire is $$4.0 \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~m}$$ and Young's modulus of the metal is $$2.0 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{m}^2$$. The longitudinal strain developed in the wire is $$\frac{1}{\alpha \pi}$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _________. [Use $$g=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2$$]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body of mass '$$m$$' is projected with a speed '$$u$$' making an angle of $$45^{\circ}$$ with the ground. The angular momentum of the body about the point of projection, at the highest point is expressed as $$\frac{\sqrt{2} m u^3}{X g}$$. The value of '$$X$$' is _________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the following circuit, the battery has an emf of $$2 \mathrm{~V}$$ and an internal resistance of $$\frac{2}{3} \Omega$$. The power consumption in the entire circuit is _________ W.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two circular coils $$P$$ and $$Q$$ of 100 turns each have same radius of $$\pi \mathrm{~cm}$$. The currents in $$P$$ and $$R$$ are $$1 A$$ and $$2 A$$ respectively. $$P$$ and $$Q$$ are placed with their planes mutually perpendicular with their centers coincide. The resultant magnetic field induction at the center of the coils is $$\sqrt{x} ~m T$$, where $$x=$$ __________.

[Use $$\mu_0=4 \pi \times 10^{-7} \mathrm{~TmA}^{-1}$$]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two identical spheres each of mass $$2 \mathrm{~kg}$$ and radius $$50 \mathrm{~cm}$$ are fixed at the ends of a light rod so that the separation between the centers is $$150 \mathrm{~cm}$$. Then, moment of inertia of the system about an axis perpendicular to the rod and passing through its middle point is $$\frac{x}{20} \mathrm{~kg} \mathrm{m^{2 }}$$, where the value of $$x$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Light from a point source in air falls on a convex curved surface of radius $$20 \mathrm{~cm}$$ and refractive index 1.5. If the source is located at $$100 \mathrm{~cm}$$ from the convex surface, the image will be formed at ________ $$\mathrm{cm}$$ from the object.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A nucleus has mass number $$A_1$$ and volume $$V_1$$. Another nucleus has mass number $$A_2$$ and Volume $$V_2$$. If relation between mass number is $$A_2=4 A_1$$, then $$\frac{V_2}{V_1}=$$ __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The distance between charges $$+q$$ and $$-q$$ is $$2 l$$ and between $$+2 q$$ and $$-2 q$$ is $$4 l$$. The electrostatic potential at point $$P$$ at a distance $$r$$ from center $$O$$ is $$-\alpha\left[\frac{q l}{r^2}\right] \times 10^9 \mathrm{~V}$$, where the value of $$\alpha$$ is __________. (Use $$\frac{1}{4 \pi \varepsilon_0}=9 \times 10^9 \mathrm{~Nm}^2 \mathrm{C}^{-2}$$)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The magnetic flux $$\phi$$ (in weber) linked with a closed circuit of resistance $$8 \Omega$$ varies with time (in seconds) as $$\phi=5 t^2-36 t+1$$. The induced current in the circuit at $$t=2 \mathrm{~s}$$ is __________ A.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The time period of simple harmonic motion of mass $$M$$ in the given figure is $$\pi \sqrt{\frac{\alpha M}{5 k}}$$, where the value of $$\alpha$$ is _________.
